results.abstract: Drivers are being ordered to install a GPS-like system in China’s largest prefecture, in Xinjiang, a far western region where ethnic tensions sometimes turn violent.

media.caption: A taxi in Kashgar, which lies west of the Bayingol Mongol Autonomous Prefecture, where drivers are being ordered to install Chinese-made GPS-like navigation equipment. The system can be used to track people in the volatile Xinjiang region in far western China.

results.adx_keywords: Bayingolin Mongol Autonomous Prefecture (China);Xinjiang (China);Uighurs (Chinese Ethnic Group);Global Positioning System;Communist Party of China;Automobiles;Terrorism
results.title: Western China Region Aims to Track People by Requiring Car Navigation
